latestVersion.termsOfUse: This dataset is available for use via a Creative Commons CC-BY license.
latestVersion.termsOfAccess: Additional data and associated records are accessible onsite at the Center for the History of Medicine, Francis A. Countway Library of Medicine, Boston, Massachusetts. Files containing health, personnel, and student information are restricted for 80 years; files containing university records are restricted for 50 years. Access requires advance notice. Contact Public Services for more information about accessing the collection.

authorName.value: Harvard School of Public Health. Longitudinal Studies of Child Health and Development

datasetContactName.value: Center for the History of Medicine (Francis A. Countway Library of Medicine)

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This dataset represents a group of paper records (a "series") within the Harvard School of Public Health Longitudinal Studies of Child Health and Development Records, 1918-2015 (inclusive), 1930-1989 (bulk), which can be accessed on-site at the Center for the History of Medicine at the Francis A. Countway Library of Medicine in Boston, Massachusetts. The series consists of research administrative records, subject participation records, and blank data collection instruments generated and collected during the original study of the Harvard School of Public Health Longitudinal Studies of Child Health and Development.

Administrative records were largely generated by Harold Coe Stuart (1891-1976), and include correspondence, file inventories, progress reports, personnel records, grant funding records, teaching records, meeting minutes, publications, and collected resources. Subject participation records consist of subject lists, enrollment records, and subject series designations. Blank data collection instruments include physical, dental, and anthropometric examination forms; social and medical history forms; psychological development forms; nutrition history forms; Wetzel Grids for Evaluating Physical Fitness; growth and percentile charts; and various other grids. Research areas include: health; physical development; nutrition; psychological health and development; prenatal health; and social functioning. Series also includes occasional raw and analyzed data tables and charts. Some records are in French and German.

Attached to the "Administrative and Regulatory Records, 1929-1962" dataset are files, digitized from their original paper copies, that serve as examples of the records that may be found in the series. Additional data and associated records are accessible onsite at the Center for the History of Medicine per the conditions governing access described below.

Conditions Governing Access to Original Collection Materials: The series represented by this dataset includes longitudinal patient information that is restricted for 80 years from the most recently dated records in the collection, personnel information that is restricted for 80 years from the date of record creation, and Harvard University records that are restricted for 50 years from the date of record creation. Researchers should contact Public Services for more information.

The Harvard School of Public Health Longitudinal Studies of Child Health and Development records were processed with grant funding from the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation, as awarded and administered by the Council on Library and Information Resources (CLIR) in 2016. An online finding aid to the collection may be accessed here: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:HMS.Count:med00211

seriesName.value: Harvard School of Public Health. Longitudinal Studies of Child Health and Development Records

seriesInformation.value: The Harvard School of Public Health Longitudinal Studies of Child Health and Development records, 1918-2015 (inclusive), 1930-1989 (bulk), are the product of research by the Department of Maternal and Child Health on the health, physical development, and social functioning of a set of subjects from birth through adulthood.

files.description: Blank charts used to record physcial growth of infant boys, boys, infant girls, and girls, in relation to average growth percentiles. Infant charts have curves for length, weight, and head circumference for 0-28 months. Child charts have curves for length/height and weight for 2-13 years. Each chart is accompanied by a description. Percentiles shown on chart were developed with data from this longitudinal growth study.
files.label: Anthropometric Growth Curve Charts

dataFile.description: Blank charts used to record physcial growth of infant boys, boys, infant girls, and girls, in relation to average growth percentiles. Infant charts have curves for length, weight, and head circumference for 0-28 months. Child charts have curves for length/height and weight for 2-13 years. Each chart is accompanied by a description. Percentiles shown on chart were developed with data from this longitudinal growth study.

files.description: Blank data collection instrument used to summarize child's development from birth to 60 months. Measurements include: length and stature, sitting length and height; trunk and leg length; weight; bi-cristal and instercristal; bi-spinal and bi-trochanteric; chest circumference and abdominal circumference; chest breadth and depth; bi-humeral and bi-acromial; head circumference; head breadth and depth; and face.
files.label: Anthropometric Measurement Percentile History Record - Birth to 60 Months

dataFile.filename: Anthropometric Measurement Percentile History Record - Birth to 60 Months
dataFile.description: Blank data collection instrument used to summarize child's development from birth to 60 months. Measurements include: length and stature, sitting length and height; trunk and leg length; weight; bi-cristal and instercristal; bi-spinal and bi-trochanteric; chest circumference and abdominal circumference; chest breadth and depth; bi-humeral and bi-acromial; head circumference; head breadth and depth; and face.

files.description: Summary data tables on anthropometric measurements and osseous development between 0 and 6 years, developed using data from this longitudinal study. Subjects include: range of appearance of osseous centers of extremities; anthropometric measurement norms; and appearance and time of frusion of bone centers in extremities.
files.label: Anthropometric Measurements and Osseous Development by Age Data Tables

dataFile.filename: Anthropometric Measurements and Osseous Development by Age Data Tables
dataFile.description: Summary data tables on anthropometric measurements and osseous development between 0 and 6 years, developed using data from this longitudinal study. Subjects include: range of appearance of osseous centers of extremities; anthropometric measurement norms; and appearance and time of frusion of bone centers in extremities.

files.description: Blank data collection instrument instruments used to record daily routine adjustment, general adjustment, and physical, intellectual, social, and emotional development.
files.label: Child Development and Adjustment Records

dataFile.description: Blank data collection instrument instruments used to record daily routine adjustment, general adjustment, and physical, intellectual, social, and emotional development.

files.description: Charts displaying average tooth emergence and formation, developed by the Forsyth Dental Infirmary and Fels Research Institute. Also included are reference diagrams showing tooth formation stages.
files.label: Dental Development Charts and Reference Diagrams

dataFile.filename: Dental Development Charts and Reference Diagrams
dataFile.description: Charts displaying average tooth emergence and formation, developed by the Forsyth Dental Infirmary and Fels Research Institute. Also included are reference diagrams showing tooth formation stages.

files.description: Blank data collection instrument used to record infant appearance, health and body mechanisms.
files.label: Infant Physical Examination Record

dataFile.description: Blank data collection instrument used to record infant appearance, health and body mechanisms.

files.description: Blank data collection instrument used to record maternal and paternal health histories, physical examination, and orthopedic examination.

dataFile.filename: Maternal and Paternal Health and Orthopedic Record
dataFile.description: Blank data collection instrument used to record maternal and paternal health histories, physical examination, and orthopedic examination.

files.description: Blank data collection instrument used to record mother's nutrition, health, and activities during each trimester of pregnancy. Also includes a sheet entitled "Suggestions for Diet during Pregnancy."
files.label: Maternal Nutrition and Health Habit Record

dataFile.filename: Maternal Nutrition and Health Habit Record
dataFile.description: Blank data collection instrument used to record mother's nutrition, health, and activities during each trimester of pregnancy. Also includes a sheet entitled "Suggestions for Diet during Pregnancy."

dataFile.description: Blank data collection instrument used to record subject's diet during a single day.

files.description: Blank data collection instrument used to summarize child's and parents' orthopedic exams from birth to 78 months.
files.label: Orthopedic Examination Record (With Family Data)

dataFile.description: Blank data collection instrument used to summarize child's and parents' orthopedic exams from birth to 78 months.

files.description: Male and female osseous development rating charts for boys and girls ages 0-10 years, describing features of slow, below average, average, above average, and accelerated development.
files.label: Osseous Development Rating Charts

dataFile.description: Male and female osseous development rating charts for boys and girls ages 0-10 years, describing features of slow, below average, average, above average, and accelerated development.

files.description: Blank data collection instrument used to record data from physical examinations and health histories from birth to six years, along with summarized family health information.

dataFile.description: Blank data collection instrument used to record data from physical examinations and health histories from birth to six years, along with summarized family health information.

files.description: Blank data collection instrument used to record psychological factors in child and parents, and economic factors of the family over time.
